business.headline: Fitch retains its rating for India, sees growth at 6.5%Fitch's rating comes days after S&P Global Ratings lifted its sovereign credit rating on India, citing strong economic growth, marking its first upgrade in 18 years.
Sensex ends 329 points higher, Nifty above 24.950; Infosys gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 329.06 points to close at 81,635.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 97.65 points to end at 24,967.75.

Are wedding gifts really tax-free? Here's the answerIn India, weddings are full of joy, rituals and generous gifts. But when the celebrations end, many couples wonder, do these gifts come with hidden tax bills? The answer may surprise you.

PMO to convene big meeting tomorrow as US tariffs set to come into force: SourcesThe Prime Minister's Office will hold a high-level review meeting on August 26 to assess support measures for Indian exporters hit by higher US tariffs. The session, chaired by the PM's Principal Secretary, comes as Washington doubles duties, with Indian goods now facing a steep 50% tariff, raising cost pressures on exporters.

Why hospitals have barred cashless services from Bajaj Allianz policyholdersThe meeting between AHPI's (Association of Healthcare Providers India) will include core committee members and senior representatives from Bajaj Allianz, and is scheduled for August 28.
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on the one skill AI can't replaceNithin Kamath explained that curiosity should not be confined to a person's own role but should extend to the larger environment around them.

Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

Common empanelment explained: Why big private hospitals and insurers are at oddsCommon empanelment aims to simplify cashless insurance in India, but hospitals resist over tariffs and operational issues, leaving policyholders' access dependent on achieving fair rates, efficient settlements, and system flexibility.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again after delayed rollout of utilities?With the revised ITR utilities coming out much later than expected, taxpayers and professionals are now questioning whether the government will grant another extension to ease the compliance burden.

Mangal Electrical IPO allotment out: Check your status, possible listing gainsInvestors who applied for the Mangal Electrical IPO can check their allotment status through two official platforms, the BSE website and the IPO registrar, Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Online gaming law: Will users get Dream11, MPL, Winzo wallet cash?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro rally: Why are IT stocks rising today?Analysts said the rally reflects expectations that lower US interest rates will make emerging markets, including India, more attractive to foreign investors, supporting inflows into the sector.

entertainment.headline: Britney Spears' fans concerned after she shares nude photo with cryptic postPop star Britney Spears' latest nude Instagram post has set the internet abuzz. Fans are concerned about her well-being.

Walking Dead actor Norman Reedus' son Mingus pleads not guilty to assault chargesMingus Reedus, the son of 'The Walking Dead' actor Norman Reedus and supermodel Helena Christensen, has pleaded not guilty to a series of misdemeanour charges in Manhattan.

Singer Karan Aujla recalls surviving six gun attacks in Canada, calls Punjab safestPunjabi singer-rapper Karan Aujla opened up about surviving multiple gunfire attacks in Canada and the criticism he faced for moving to Dubai. He explained why choosing his family's safety over public perception was the only decision he could make.

Rise & Fall trailer: Dhanashree talks about broken trust on Ashneer Grover showHosted by entrepreneur Ashneer Grover, the trailer for 'Rise & Fall', was released on Monday. It gave a glimpse into the show, featuring 16 celebrity contestants, including Arjun Bijlani, Dhanashree Verma, Kiku Sharda and Kubbra Sait.

No grudges: Ashish Vidyarthi says Apoorva Mukhija apologised after The TraitorsActor Ashish Vidyarthi denied being on bad terms with influencer Apoorva Mukhija after 'The Traitors'. He said the Rebel Kid apologised for disrespectfully talking about him on the show. Vidyarthi also said that he advised Mukhija to carve her own path.

Rakesh Roshan shares it took six months to design Hrithik's iconic Krrish maskDirector Rakesh Roshan shared that it took six months to design actor Hrithik Roshan's iconic Krrish mask, which was made of wax and required special care as it melted within hours.

Farah Khan attends Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh, shares video from her spiritual visitFarah Khan attended the Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh for the first time, calling it a beautiful and divine experience blessed with rain. She also announced YouTube FanFest 2025, which will feature over 20 creators and artists across comedy, music, dance, gaming, and more.

Sunny Deol praises Aryan Khan's debut Ba***ds of Bollywood, says SRK will be proudAryan Khan's directorial debut 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' received praise from Sunny Deol, who shared the show's preview and a heartfelt note calling it absolutely fantastic. The Netflix satire, featuring Bobby Deol and cameos by Salman Khan, Ranveer Singh, and Karan Johar, will stream from September 18.

Who is Ashnoor Kaur, Bigg Boss 19's youngest contestant?Ashnoor Kaur is the youngest contestant on 'Bigg Boss 19' this year. Her entry has sparked curiosity about how she will face the show's intense drama and politics.

Kingdom OTT release: When and where to watch Vijay Deverakonda's crime thrillerVijay Deverakonda's action drama 'Kingdom' is set to premiere on Netflix in multiple languages after its theatrical release. The film, directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri, features a gripping undercover mission with a personal twist.

Gustaakh Ishq teaser: Manish Malhotra brings old-school romance with Vijay-FatimaIn 'Gustaakh Ishq', producer Manish Malhotra lets old-school romance take over our screens. Headlined by Fatima Sana Shaikh and Vijay Varma, the film also boasts strong performances by Naseeruddin Shah and Sharib Hashmi.

Actor Ravi Mohan, Keneeshaa visit Tirupati ahead of his production house launchActor Ravi Mohan and singer Keneeshaa Francis visited Tirupati temple recently. This visit comes ahead of the actor's grand launch of his production house.

Actor Swasika, 33, says she was asked to play Ram Charan's mother in PeddiActor Swasika recently shared her surprise at being offered the role of Ram Charan's mother in the Telugu film 'Peddi'. The upcoming Telugu film will also star Janhvi Kapoor and Shivarajkumar.

Priyanka Chopra, Katrina Kaif lead celeb wishes on Parineeti-Raghav's pregnancyCelebs including Priyanka Chopra, Katrina Kaif and Ananya Panday, among others, sent hugs and best wishes to Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha as the couple announced their pregnancy on Monday morning.

Songs of Paradise trailer: Saba Azad, Soni Razdan in film on Melody Queen of KashmirPrime Video has released the trailer for Songs of Paradise, a musical inspired by Raj Begum's life. The film celebrates Kashmir's rich musical heritage and female resilience.

Kannada actor Dinesh Mangaluru of KGF and Kantara fame dies at 55Kannada actor Dinesh Mangaluru died at 63, with his last rites scheduled to take place in Bengaluru. He was famous for his roles in 'KGF', 'Kantara' and 'Kirik Party', among others.

Shilpa Shetty skips annual Ganapati celebration due to family mourningShilpa Shetty has announced that she will not be hosting her usual grand Ganpati celebrations this year as her family observes a 13-day mourning period following a bereavement. She shared her heartfelt regret on Instagram, seeking understanding.

Leadergiri mat kar: Called out on day one, but who is Mridul Tiwari in BB 19?'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Mridul Tiwari commands a massive online following, with 4.5 million followers on Instagram and over 19 million subscribers on YouTube.

Aavesham track used in Netflix's Splinter Cell, composer questions lack of credit'Aavesham' composer Sushin Shyam questioned the omission of credit in the Netflix trailer of 'Splinter Cell: Deathwatch'.  Netflix is yet to respond to him.

general news.headline: No need to disclose details of PM's degree: High Court overturns panel's orderThe Delhi High Court set aside the Central Information Commissioner's 2016 order and ruled that Delhi University need not disclose details of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 1978 graduation degree.

If 'vote chori' is true, how Congress got its highest vote share in 35 years? BJPThe BJP countered Congress's 'vote chori' charge, with Amit Malviya stating that the Congress and its allies secured its highest vote share in 35 years in the 2024 elections.

Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

India warns Pak over J&K floods in rare goodwill gesture amid Indus treaty freezeThe communication was made by the Indian High Commission in Islamabad on Sunday to the Pakistani Foreign Ministry on the matter. This is the first time that an information regarding such a matter has been sent via the High Commission.

When women die, we scroll: India's outrage gap on gendered violenceViolence against women is not accidental or spontaneous; it is structural, patterned, and legitimised through custom, silence, and legal delay. It is no longer perceived as a rupture but as routine, an unending cycle that reveals a society deeply invested in disciplining, diminishing, and discarding women.

Will US deport Green Card, visa holders using old drunk-driving cases?A new US bill could make a single drink and drive case, even from years ago, the grounds for deportation or entry denial for Green Card and visa holders. Immigrant communities and experts fear it could bypass due process and disproportionately affect legal residents. The bill could affect lakhs of Indians working or studying in the US.

CPM leaders instigated mob to vandalise RG Kar hospital: Kolkata Police chargesheetThe unruly mob completely vandalised the ground floor of the emergency ward of RG Kar hospital in the night of August 14. Several officials and police personnel were injured during the vandalism. A total of five cases were registered by Kolkata police in this matter.

Voter Adhikar Yatra: 'BJP's vote chori, dubious 'double engine' has riled Bihar'Q&A with CPI(ML) Liberation general secretary Dipankar Bhattacharya on the impact of Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar Yatra and Prashant Kishor's prospects in the Bihar assembly polls
Sergio Gor and the new US Great Game in AsiaDonald Trump's new envoy to New Delhi coincides with the return of the US to South and Central Asia.

Bengal student shot dead at home, cops suspect she was killed over breakupA college student preparing for the NEET medical entrance exam was shot dead at her residence in Krishnanagar. Police suspect a former friend behind the crime.

Like Hitler celebrating Jews: BJP slams Kerala's invite to Stalin for Ayyappa eventThe BJP launched a blistering attack on the Kerala government for inviting Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin to the Global Ayyappa Sangamam, calling it hypocrisy and likening it to "Hitler celebrating Jews."

Scientists confirm strongest-ever alien signal. It never repeatedNicknamed RBFLOAT — Radio Brightest Flash Of All Time — this ultrabright burst lasted just milliseconds but outshone every other radio source in its host galaxy during that fleeting moment.

CBSE vs ICSE: Why are there fewer ICSE schools despite its strong reputation?ICSE schools remain fewer but are highly valued for their rigorous syllabus and strong English foundations. This exclusivity highlights quality education focused on holistic learning rather than mass expansion.

Will Sergio Gor open DC doors for Delhi or give India Trump's jolt?Donald Trump's nomination of Sergio Gor as ambassador to India offers New Delhi a rare direct line to the US President, given his access and proximity. Yet Gor's lack of diplomatic experience, unclear stance on tariffs and India-Pakistan ties, and overlapping role as Special Envoy create uncertainties. What does it mean for India?

Tailor strangles woman over money dispute, dumps her body in Delhi drain, arrestedA man killed a woman and dumped her body in a drain allegedly over a money dispute in Delhi. He was arrested two days later by the police in Uttar Pradesh.

Hiring: Doomscrollers. The job nobody saw comingWhat if we told you that being a doomscroller could actually land you a job? Yes, companies are now hiring them - and a viral LinkedIn post by a Mumbai-based entrepreneur scouting for doomscrollers is proof.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha announce pregnancy: Blessed beyond measureParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha are going to welcome their first child soon. The couple announced the news on social media.

Why startups still want freshers while big companies pull backIndia's fresher job market is cooling overall, but startups and retail players are defying the slowdown. Even as big corporates cut entry-level hiring, agile firms are betting big on fresh talent to fuel growth.

Gustaakh Ishq teaser: Manish Malhotra brings old-school romance with Vijay-FatimaIn 'Gustaakh Ishq', producer Manish Malhotra lets old-school romance take over our screens. Headlined by Fatima Sana Shaikh and Vijay Varma, the film also boasts strong performances by Naseeruddin Shah and Sharib Hashmi.

How India's forex reserve rebound is a march towards stability in money marketsFrom record highs to sharp declines and a resilient rebound, India's foreign exchange reserves tell a story of strategic economic shifts and robust domestic drivers

Ahmedabad school stabbing: Why are children turning violent?A Class 10 student was fatally stabbed by a junior during a school fight in Ahmedabad. The incident exposes growing youth aggression and urgent mental health challenges in Indian schools.

Singer Karan Aujla recalls surviving six gun attacks in Canada, calls Punjab safestPunjabi singer-rapper Karan Aujla opened up about surviving multiple gunfire attacks in Canada and the criticism he faced for moving to Dubai. He explained why choosing his family's safety over public perception was the only decision he could make.

ED raids Trinamool MLA's home, he scales wall and tries to flee; arrestedTrinamool MLA, upon learning of the raid, reportedly tried to flee by scaling the boundary wall of his house but was apprehended by ED officers in a nearby agricultural field, covered in mud.

Israeli strike on Gaza hospital kills at least 15, including journalistsThe attack came after Israel's military announced the first steps of an operation to take over Gaza City last week and called up tens of thousands of reservists while the Benjamin Netanyahu government considered a new ceasefire proposal to pause nearly two years of war.

Shriya Pilgaonkar joins Akshay, Saif in Priyadarshan's thriller Haiwaan. ReportsActor Shriya Pilgaonkar has joined director Priyadarshan's upcoming thriller Haiwaan. The film is a Hindi remake of the Malayalam hit 'Oppam' and marks a major reunion of actors Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan.

Walking Dead actor Norman Reedus' son Mingus pleads not guilty to assault chargesMingus Reedus, the son of 'The Walking Dead' actor Norman Reedus and supermodel Helena Christensen, has pleaded not guilty to a series of misdemeanour charges in Manhattan.

Ranbir Kapoor, Vicky Kaushal's bromance steals show at Mumbai airport. VideoActors Ranbir Kapoor and Vicky Kaushal were clicked at the Mumbai airport on Monday evening. The duo's bromance was the highlight of their appearance.

Rise & Fall trailer: Dhanashree talks about broken trust on Ashneer Grover showHosted by entrepreneur Ashneer Grover, the trailer for 'Rise & Fall', was released on Monday. It gave a glimpse into the show, featuring 16 celebrity contestants, including Arjun Bijlani, Dhanashree Verma, Kiku Sharda and Kubbra Sait.

sports.headline: Mirabai Chanu returns to action in style with gold in Commonwealth ChampionshipsMirabai Chanu made a strong comeback by winning gold at the Commonwealth Championships in Ahmedabad. Her record-breaking performance sets high expectations for upcoming World Championships and Asian Games.

Asia Cup 2025: Harshit Rana sharpens skills in Delhi Premier leagueIndia fast bowler Harshit Rana is sharpening his skills in the Delhi Premier League 2025 (DPL 2025) ahead of the Asia Cup set to begin on September 9.

Nadal Academy star rejoices historic win with unreal comeback vs Clara TausonAlexandra Eala made history at the 2025 US Open, becoming the first Filipino in the Open Era to win a Grand Slam main-draw match. The 19-year-old stunned 14th seed Clara Tauson with a thrilling 6-3, 2-6, 7-6 comeback victory.

Khalid Jamil unveils first India squad for CAFA Cup: No Mohun Bagan playersKhalid Jamil's first India squad for the CAFA Nations Cup omits Mohun Bagan Super Giant players after the club refused to release them. Gurpreet Singh Sandhu returns as East Bengal players headline the 23-man list.

Who is Francesca Jones? British player with 8 fingers, 7 toes set for debutFrancesca Jones, a 24-year-old Briton born with Ectrodactyly Ectodermal Dysplasia, is set for her 2025 US Open main draw debut after a strong run through qualifying.

1st round is the final: Lakshya Sen on facing Shi Yuqi in World ChampionshipsIndia's Lakshya Sen will be competing against top-seeded Shi Yuqi in the first round of the BWF World Championships. A confident Lakshya is going into the match hoping to cause a big upset.

Ex-South Africa captain makes retirement U-turn, in line for Women's World CupDane van Niekerk has revoked her retirement and returned to international contention, with her name featuring in South Africa's training squad for the upcoming Women's ODI World Cup.

Daniil Medvedev plays victim after US Open outburst: They fine guys like me moreUS Open 2025: Daniil Medvedev said he expected a hefty fine after his extraordinary outburst during Sunday's first-round defeat. The Russian lost his cool before crashing out in the opening round of a Grand Slam for the third successive time this year.

Arsenal learn Bukayo Saka injury timeline ahead of trip to LiverpoolBukayo Saka is set to miss Arsenal's trip to Liverpool on Sunday, as well as England's World Cup qualifiers against Andorra and Serbia next month.

Novak Djokovic to hire Monica Seles as coach? Serb legend opens upNovak Djokovic revealed he is exploring a short-term coaching collaboration with childhood idol Monica Seles, describing it as more emotional than long-term. On court, Djokovic overcame Learner Tien in straight sets to reach the US Open second round.

Fantasy Nightmare: BCCI begins hunt for new sponsor after Dream11 walks outDream11 has ended its title sponsorship of the Indian cricket team following the government's ban on real money gaming. The BCCI is now actively searching for a new sponsor but may not finalise one before the upcoming Asia Cup.

Ex-South Africa captain makes retirement U-turn, in line for Women's World CupDane van Niekerk has revoked her retirement and returned to international contention, with her name featuring in South Africa's training squad for the upcoming Women's ODI World Cup.

The Russian lost his cool before crashing out in the opening round of a Grand Slam for the third successive time this year.

Arsenal learn Bukayo Saka injury timeline ahead of trip to LiverpoolBukayo Saka is set to miss Arsenal's trip to Liverpool on Sunday, as well as England's World Cup qualifiers against Andorra and Serbia next month.

Novak Djokovic to hire Monica Seles as coach? Serb legend opens upNovak Djokovic revealed he is exploring a short-term coaching collaboration with childhood idol Monica Seles, describing it as more emotional than long-term. On court, Djokovic overcame Learner Tien in straight sets to reach the US Open second round.

Fantasy Nightmare: BCCI begins hunt for new sponsor after Dream11 walks outDream11 has ended its title sponsorship of the Indian cricket team following the government's ban on real money gaming. The BCCI is now actively searching for a new sponsor but may not finalise one before the upcoming Asia Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
